Key Match Events: Michael Busch hit a go-ahead RBI single in the third inning.
Michael Busch hit a solo homer in the seventh inning.
Michael Busch hit another solo homer in the ninth inning, increasing his season total to 20.
Pete Crow-Armstrong hit a two-run homer in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs manager Craig Counsell praised the team's offensive effort despite leaving many runners on base.
Rockies manager Bud Black noted that Cal Quantrill's performance was affected by walking 12 batters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago Cubs went 3 for 14 with runners in scoring position and stranded 16 runners, tying the major league high for a nine-inning game this season.
Kyle Hendricks became the first pitcher in Cubs history to throw at least six innings while allowing two or fewer hits and one or fewer runs in a start at Coors Field.
